mdRecord.dcterms:title: Carrel 4-15, northwest wall
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lee, Jenny [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: In cursive, an attributed line from John Donne's "Holy Sonnet X (Death, Be not Proud)." Advice to trust no man (possibly an unattributed quote); another responds, connecting this phrase to a UVA football coach, Bronco Mendenhall. Unattributed quote, partially in cursive, of James Russell Lowell. [work]
Student graffiti art and messages inscribed on carrel walls in the new stacks, Alderman Library, University of Virginia, prior to the renovation of the building, 2020-2023. [host]

One short sleep past, we wake eternally. - John Donne | TRUST NO MAN | (the process) | Sounds like Coach Mendenhall and UVA football | Endurance is the crowning quality, and patience all the passion of great hearts
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Poetry
Donne, John, 1572-1631
Football
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: University of Virginia. Library. New Stacks. Charlottesville, Virginia, United States
